Given below are two statements: Statement (I): When an object is placed at the centre of curvature of a concave lens, image is formed at the centre of curvature of the lens on the other side. Statement (II): Concave lens always forms a virtual and erect image. questions.latexText: \(An astronaut takes a ball of mass m from earth to space. He throws the ball into a circular orbit about earth at an altitude of 318.5 km. From earth’s surface to the orbit, the change in total mechanical energy of the ball is \frac{e}{e}GM m x^{21}R . The value of x is (take R e = 6370 km): (1) 11 (2) 9 (3) 12 (4) 10\)

questions.text: Given below are two statements: Statement (I) : When currents vary with time, Newton’s third law is valid only if momentum carried by the electromagnetic field is taken into account. Statement (II) : Ampere’s circuital law does not depend on Biot-Savart’s law. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (1) Both Statement I and Statement II are false. (2) Statement I is true but Statement II is false. (3) Statement I is false but Statement II is true. (4) Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
questions.formattedText: Given below are two statements: Statement (I) : When currents vary with time, Newton’s third law is valid only if momentum carried by the electromagnetic field is taken into account. Statement (II) : Ampere’s circuital law does not depend on Biot-Savart’s law. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (1) Both Statement I and Statement II are false. (2) Statement I is true but Statement II is false. (3) Statement I is false but Statement II is true. (4) Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
questions.latexText: \(Given below are two statements: Statement (I) : When currents vary with time, Newton’s third law is valid only if momentum carried by the electromagnetic field is taken into account. Statement (II) : Ampere’s circuital law does not depend on Biot-Savart’s law. (3) Statement I is false but Statement II is true. (4) Both Statement I and Statement II are true.\)
